author: Andrew T. Culjak

review: There's a lot to to like about the Fire TV stick. It's small, feature-packed, and affordable. What I dislike though is the WiFi streaming issues it has - my Fire TV stick is about ten inches away from my router, and regardless of whether or not I have it on the 2.4 Ghz or the 5 Ghz network, I routinely get Netflix quality drops (where it goes from HD to SD) and it stops to re-buffer. I see no such issues on the Roku units I use. I don't know what the issue is exactly, but overall I don't find the Fire TV Stick to be reliable at Netflix streaming, which is the primary reason I bought it. I'm hoping a future firmware update will improve the reliability. It also doesn't have a UFC.tv app, but I don't fault Amazon for that yet - I'm assuming they're working on that, and many other, partnerships.UPDATE: Well, it's been a few months now, and nothing has changed. The Fire TV sputters and stutters regularly, making for a fairly frustrating experience some days. Amazon really needs to work on optimizing the video playback experience.

review: Worked right out of the box and seems to do everything it's supposed to do. Replaced a malfunctioning Roku with it after the replacement Roku was malfunctioning too. The Fire TV stick just worked, right away, no fuss. Good product.

review: I do like the Fire TV Stick.  However, the movie offerings changed after my first use of it.  Walking with Beasts was excellent, and free, and Iooked forward to watching the others in the series.  However a couple of days later the others were no longer available for free.
